perturbation.original_text: This Promotion and Distribution Agreement including all exhibits (collectively referred to as the "Agreement"), effective as of 1 August 2011 (the  "Effective Date"), is made by and between Whitesmoke Inc., with registered offices/principle place of business at 501 Silverside Road, Suite 105,  Wilmington DE 19809, USA, ("Distributor"), and Google Inc whose principle place of business is at 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View,  CA 94043, USA ("Google").
perturbation.changed_text: This Promotion and Distribution Agreement including all exhibits (collectively referred to as the "Contract"), effective as of 1 August 2011 (the  "Effective Date"), is made by and between Whitesmoke Inc., with registered offices/principle place of business at 501 Silverside Road, Suite 105,  Wilmington DE 19809, USA, ("Wholesaler"), and Google Inc whose principle place of business is at 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View,  CA 94043, USA ("Google").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Agreement' is replaced with 'Contract', and 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Wholesaler'. Later uses of 'Agreement' and 'Distributor' remain unchanged, creating confusion about which term/entity is being referenced, and which definition is applicable.

perturbation.original_text: 2.1 Products License Grant. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Google grants to Distributor a [* ] license during the  Term to: (a) bundle the Distribution Products, in machine-readable binary code format only, solely with Distributor App(s); (b) distribute  Bundles directly (or indirectly, subject to Clause 2.2 (Third Party Distribution)) to End Users in the Territory; (c) when indicated by the  applicable Criteria Checker and requested by the End User in accordance with clause 3.2 (Form of Distribution Offering), install the  Chrome Browser or the Google Toolbar (as applicable) on the End User's system using the Google Installers; and (d) reproduce (or have  reproduced by Third Party Distributors as defined in Clause 2.2 (Third Party Distribution)), the Distribution Products to the extent  necessary to exercise the rights granted in (a), (b) and (c).
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 Products License Grant. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Contract, Google grants to Vendor a [* ] license during the  Term to: (a) bundle the Distribution Products, in machine-readable binary code format only, solely with Vendor App(s); (b) distribute  Bundles directly (or indirectly, subject to Clause 2.2 (Third Party Distribution)) to End Users in the Territory; (c) when indicated by the  applicable Criteria Checker and requested by the End User in accordance with clause 3.2 (Form of Distribution Offering), install the  Chrome Browser or the Google Toolbar (as applicable) on the End User's system using the Google Installers; and (d) reproduce (or have  reproduced by Third Party Distributors as defined in Clause 2.2 (Third Party Distribution)), the Distribution Products to the extent  necessary to exercise the rights granted in (a), (b) and (c).
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Agreement' is replaced with 'Contract' and 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Vendor' only in this section. Since in the definition paragraph, 'Distributor' = Whitesmoke and later in the contract it's not changed, it creates ambiguity if the 'Vendor' is different from 'Distributor'.

perturbation.original_text: 10.4 Distributor [ * ] and will indemnify Google against all liabilities, costs, damages and expenses (including settlement costs approved in  writing by Distributor and reasonable legal fees [ * ]) suffered or incurred by Google or any Google Group Company arising from: (a)  Distributor's improper (ie not in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement including the Exhibits) or unauthorised, replication,  packaging, marketing, distribution, or installation of the Products, including any breach of Clause 8.5 and any claims based on  representations, warranties, or misrepresentations made by Distributor, (b) any claim from a third party that the Distributor App(s)  infringe any third party copyright, trademark, or trade secret, or (c) any End
perturbation.changed_text: 10.4 Supplier [ * ] and will indemnify Google against all liabilities, costs, damages and expenses (including settlement costs approved in  writing by Supplier and reasonable legal fees [ * ]) suffered or incurred by Google or any Google Group Company arising from: (a)  Distributor's improper (ie not in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement including the Exhibits) or unauthorised, replication,  packaging, marketing, distribution, or installation of the Products, including any breach of Clause 8.5 and any claims based on  representations, warranties, or misrepresentations made by Distributor, (b) any claim from a third party that the Distributor App(s)  infringe any third party copyright, trademark, or trade secret, or (c) any End
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Supplier' at the start of this section, but in the same sentence, it uses the term 'Distributor' which could be another party in the contract, thus creating contradiction. This change makes unclear who will provide the indemnification and which entity is tied to the listed liabilities. This uncertainty affects the enforcement of indemnification obligations.
